Description

This component is used to provide mixed capability of ngIf and ngShow.
When a content is getting visible for the first time it is displayed through ngIf so a content gets compiled. On successive hiding/displaying it is displayed through ngShow so no additional compilation is needed.

Motivation

Sometimes it happens that very complex Angular page is created so it is reasonable to wrap few parts with ngIf. Then it may be shown or hidden depending on user actions.
If showing again it is wise not to compile everything again since repetitive displaying may cause some AJAX calls, building of objects and so on. Common situation occurs with expander control where show/hide action is typically taken.

Visible: {{visible}}

Toggle panel

Here comes the content panel when visible.
    The panel contains a value that is set in ngOnInit which demonstrates it gets compiled just once on the first
    load.
ngOnInit ran on {{initDate}}. It proves that it is called just once.
